measured_by: threshold parameter (boundary separation) of evidence accumulation models
justification: “Threshold is the amount of evidence needed to trigger a response. This parameter measures response caution.”

measured_by: drift rate parameter of evidence accumulation models
justification: “Drift rate is the rate at which evidence in favour of a decision accumulates… This measure is thought to reflect the signal-to-noise ratio provided by the stimulus.”
construct: quality/quantity of evidence / stimulus signal-to-noise / task ability

measured_by: start-point (start point noise) parameter of evidence accumulation models
justification: “Start point noise… quantifies the a priori bias towards a response option. The more evidence in favour of a response at the outset… the higher the response bias.”

measured_by: non-decision time parameter of evidence accumulation models
justification: “Non-decision time is a measure of the time it takes to complete all processes that are thought to fall outside the decision-making process… such as pressing a button to indicate a response.”
